Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (partly worn); exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (part of rump with added red blob and tail remaining) to right; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 34 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. For parallels regarding the lion, see the lion on Lemos no. 236, one of the Würzburg chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0081) (phase 2)
